dimension: 14 1/4 x 19 3/8 in. (36.2 x 49.21 cm) (sheet, trimmed within platemark)
inscription: Below image, at left: C. Vanloo prim. Pictor Regius invenit.; below image, at right: F. P. Charpentier B. Sculpsit.;
medium: Etching and aquatint printed in brown (from two plates)
text: A 1762 advertisement in a Paris paper announced, “Monsieurs Charpentier and Floding, authors of a new manner of engraving which imitates wash perfectly, are releasing six prints in this taste.” Perseus and Andromeda was among the first aquatints they published. It reproduces a drawing by Carle Vanloo, First Painter to the King (Premier Peintre du Roi). To make his aquatints, Charpentier reportedly built a special machine that was largely funded by a Swedish drawing collector, Count Carl Gustav Tessin.
title: Perseus and Andromeda
